intro: Ornithidium paleatum, commonly known as the pale spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and rough, hairy leaves. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in dry conditions. Ornithidium paleatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
